<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

static int
check_param__epoll (void)
{
  if (! tool_params.epoll)
    return ! 0;
  if (MHD_NO == MHD_is_feature_supported (MHD_FEATURE_EPOLL))
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "'epoll' was requested, but this MHD build does not "
             "support 'epoll' functionality.\n");
    return 0;
  }
  return ! 0;
}

The two if conditions are: 1) if (!tool_params.epoll) — depends on the (mutable) variable tool_params.epoll; 2) if (MHD_NO == MHD_is_feature_supported(MHD_FEATURE_EPOLL)) — depends on a function call result. There are no loops or selection statements with constant/compile-time invariant controlling expressions. The uses of the constant-computation '!0' appear only in return expressions, which are not controlling expressions and thus outside the scope of MISRA C Rule 14.3.
